item.title: A Random Walk with Dice
item.description: Photo by Jonathan Petersson on Unsplash I recently came across an interesting probability question from Nate Rosidi, maintainer of the data science prep site Strata Scratch. This question was asked by FiveThirtyEight and goes like this: You start with a fair 6-sided die and roll it six times, recording the results of each roll. You then write these numbers on the six faces of another, unlabeled fair die.
